description: Increased risk of gastrointestinal bleeding and reduced cardioprotective effect of aspirin
mechanism: Both inhibit COX enzymes and platelet function leading to additive GI effects
management: Avoid combination or use alternative pain reliever. If needed take aspirin first and wait 30 minutes

description: Significantly increased bleeding risk including life-threatening hemorrhage
mechanism: Additive anticoagulant effects through different mechanisms
management: Avoid combination unless medically necessary with close INR monitoring

description: Increased bleeding risk but may be intentionally combined for cardiac protection
mechanism: Both inhibit platelet function through different mechanisms
management: Monitor for signs of bleeding. Combination often intentional post-stent

description: May enhance blood sugar lowering effect
mechanism: ACE inhibitors may improve insulin sensitivity and glucose uptake
management: Monitor blood glucose levels more frequently

description: Risk of lactic acidosis especially with kidney impairment
mechanism: Contrast may cause acute kidney injury impairing metformin clearance
management: Stop metformin before and 48 hours after contrast procedures

description: Dual RAAS blockade increases risk of hyperkalemia and kidney problems
mechanism: Both block renin-angiotensin system causing additive effects
management: Generally avoid combination. Monitor potassium and kidney function if used

description: Risk of hyperkalemia which can cause cardiac arrhythmias
mechanism: ACE inhibitors reduce aldosterone and potassium excretion
management: Monitor potassium levels regularly. Avoid high potassium foods

description: Reduced blood pressure control and increased kidney risk
mechanism: NSAIDs reduce prostaglandins needed for ACE inhibitor action and kidney perfusion
management: Avoid long-term combination. Monitor blood pressure and kidney function

description: Additive effects on heart rate and blood pressure
mechanism: Both lower blood pressure and heart rate through different mechanisms
management: Monitor heart rate and blood pressure. Usually safe combination

description: Reduced effectiveness of both drugs in some patients
mechanism: Beta-agonist and beta-blocker have opposing effects on beta receptors
management: Use cardioselective beta-blocker if needed. Monitor asthma control

description: Significantly increased risk of muscle damage and rhabdomyolysis
mechanism: Gemfibrozil inhibits statin metabolism increasing blood levels
management: Avoid combination. Use fenofibrate if fibrate needed with statin

description: Increased statin levels and risk of side effects
mechanism: Grapefruit inhibits CYP3A4 enzyme that metabolizes atorvastatin
management: Limit grapefruit consumption or use pravastatin or rosuvastatin

description: Reduced anticoagulant effect
mechanism: Vitamin K is essential for clotting factor synthesis antagonized by warfarin
management: Maintain consistent vitamin K intake. Monitor INR closely

description: May increase anticoagulant effect with high doses or prolonged use
mechanism: Acetaminophen may affect vitamin K metabolism at high doses
management: Limit acetaminophen to less than 2g per day. Monitor INR

description: Significantly reduced ciprofloxacin absorption and effectiveness
mechanism: Metal cations in antacids bind to ciprofloxacin preventing absorption
management: Take ciprofloxacin 2 hours before or 6 hours after antacids

description: Increased theophylline levels risking toxicity
mechanism: Ciprofloxacin inhibits theophylline metabolism
management: Monitor theophylline levels. Consider dose reduction or alternative antibiotic

description: Risk of serotonin syndrome which can be life-threatening
mechanism: Both increase serotonin levels through different mechanisms
management: Contraindicated. Wait 14 days between stopping MAOI and starting SSRI

description: Increased risk of serotonin syndrome and seizures
mechanism: Both increase serotonin levels and lower seizure threshold
management: Use with caution. Monitor for serotonin syndrome symptoms

description: Reduced thyroid hormone absorption
mechanism: Calcium binds to levothyroxine in the gut preventing absorption
management: Take levothyroxine 4 hours apart from calcium supplements

description: Reduced thyroid hormone absorption
mechanism: Iron binds to levothyroxine preventing absorption
management: Take levothyroxine 4 hours apart from iron supplements

description: Reduced clopidogrel effectiveness increasing cardiac risk
mechanism: Omeprazole inhibits CYP2C19 needed to activate clopidogrel
management: Use pantoprazole instead or H2 blocker if PPI needed

description: Increased statin levels and risk of muscle problems
mechanism: Amlodipine inhibits CYP3A4 metabolism of simvastatin
management: Limit simvastatin to 20mg daily or use alternative statin

description: Significantly increased warfarin effect and bleeding risk
mechanism: Fluconazole inhibits warfarin metabolism
management: Reduce warfarin dose and monitor INR closely during treatment

description: Increased methotrexate toxicity risk
mechanism: Penicillins may reduce renal clearance of methotrexate
management: Monitor for methotrexate toxicity. Consider dose adjustment

description: Increased risk of dangerous heart rhythms
mechanism: Additive QT prolongation effect on cardiac conduction
management: Avoid combination with other QT prolonging drugs. Monitor ECG

description: Risk of serotonin syndrome
mechanism: Both increase serotonin levels in the brain
management: Monitor for serotonin syndrome symptoms. Use lowest effective doses

description: Increased sedation respiratory depression and death risk
mechanism: Additive CNS depressant effects
management: Avoid combination if possible. Use lowest doses and monitor closely

description: Increased risk of serotonin syndrome and seizures
mechanism: Both increase serotonin and tramadol lowers seizure threshold
management: Use with caution. Consider alternative pain management

description: Increased lithium levels and toxicity risk
mechanism: Thiazides reduce lithium clearance by the kidney
management: Monitor lithium levels closely. May need dose reduction

description: Risk of severe bradycardia heart block and heart failure
mechanism: Both slow heart rate and conduction through different mechanisms
management: Avoid combination. Use with extreme caution if necessary
